  LCCN = {P 1192/5},
  note = {Isis übernahme in Italien Sie [Anm. italische Kaufleute] haben dort den Kult der ägyptischen Götter kennengelertn, machen haben an dieser Religion Gefallen gefunden. [...] Italische Kaufleute, die aus Delos nachhause zurückkehrten, brachten Isis und Sarapis mit. Aus dem Jahr 105 v. Chr. haben wir einen Beschluß über den Bau eines Sarapistempels zu Puteoli. Es dürfte nicht der erste Kultpaltz des Sarapis in dieser Stadt gewesen sein. In Pompei hat ein großes Isisheiligtum bestanden [...] sie datieren diesen zwischen 105 und 80 v. Chr. [S. 129..] Unter Sulla ist der Isiskult in Rom eingeführt worden.   128 f},
  note = {Triumvirat baut Tempel für Isis im Jahr 43 haben die Triumviri (Antoinus, Octavianus und Lepidus) beschlossen, daß für Isis und Sarapis in Rom ein Tempel erbaut werde. Dies ist wohl geschen, um sich bei den einfachen Leuten beliebt zu machen.  Quelle: 	Cassius Dio 47, 15, 4  132},
  note = {Osiris - Dionysos Dieser Osiris hat nur noch wenig Ägyptisches an sich; er ist ein Dionysos der wohlhabenden Aristokratie mit einem Anflug des Exotisch-Interessanten, ist auch nicht der Dionysos der Tragödie und der Ekstase, sonder den Gott des leichten, eleganten Lebens. Aber immerhin war der Kult des Dionysos-Osiris für Messalla und Tibull ein Mysterium, wie der letzte Vers zeigt.  134},
  note = {Ägyptische Motive als Deko Die ägyptischen Motive in Boscotrecase und den anderen kaiserlichen Villen bedeuten nicht mehr, als daß man sich in Rom damit abgefunden hatte, daß Isis und Sarapis wie viele ander Götter verehrt wurden, und daß ägyptische Motive als Dekoration gefielen.  137},
  note = {Art der ägyptischen Kulte Zu dieser Entwicklung dürfte beigetragen haben, daß der Name des Zeus inzwischen dem Planete verliehen worden war, den auch wir noch Jupiter nennen, und daß dieser ''Zeus'' - der nach festgelegten Regeln die Erde umkreist - nur noch ein Gott von beschränter Bedeutung und gemindertem Ansehen sein konnte.Sarapis war mehr als Zeus. Der unpolitische Charakter der kaiserzeitlichen Isis- und Sarapis-Religion hat mitsich gebracht, daß die Teilnahme am ägyptischen Kult auf der freien Wahl des einzelnen beruhte, anders als in ägyptischer Zeit. Es hat sich - wie auch beim Christentum - weitgehend um eine Religion von Individualisten gehandelt.  306},
  note = {Gräco-ägyptischen Kulte Dieses Umdeuten der Mythen ist durch Chairemon von Alexandria in größerem Maß erfolgt. Er war ägyptischer Priester und gleichzeitig stoischer Philosoph und hat die allegorische Deutung griechischer Mythen durch die Stoiker auch auf die ägyptischen Mythen und Riten angwendet. Damit eröffnet sich ein weites Feld für Spekulationen. [...] Der Isiskult weckte tiefe religiöse Emotionen. [...] Die osirianischen Trauerfeiern endeten mit der Hoffnung auf ein besseres Jenseits. Isis schütze Witwen und Waisen, war Göttin der Gerechtigkeit und stand über dem Fatum. [...] Sowohl Sarapis als auch Isis sind als Universalgottheiten aufgefaßt worden.  307},
  note = {Ägyptische Kulte vs. Christentum ..diese ägyptischen Priester des zweiten bis vierten nachchristlichen Jahrhunderts haben sich von der Welt, die sie umgab, abgekapselt, und auf die Probleme der zu ihrer Zeit lebenden Menschen konnten sich keine Antworten geben. [...] Um in der sie umgebenden Welt zu bestehen, hätten die ägyptischen Priester in Rom, Alexandira, Mitel- und Oberägypten griechische Philosophie lernen müssen, wie dei Christen das getan haben.  309},
  key = {Merkelbach503}
}

  ISBN = {90-04-10137-3},
  edition = {},
  note = {Inhalt Viel weiterführende Literatur Angaben zu Praeneste allgemein in Fußnoten zu Kapitel II ab ca. 30},
  LCCN = {P 812 (121)},
  note = {Datierung Oberese Heiligtum  011},
  note = {Mosaik keine Zwang für heiligtum This suggestion was based on the existence of some Egyptianising monuments which have been found in, or in the neighbourhood of, the apsidal hall: the Nile Mosaic itself, two small obelisks and two inscriptions mentioning a statue of isis-Tyche and a Serapeum. The Nile Mosaic may indeed be interpreted as an illustration of the land of Isis who, in the form of Isis-Tyche may also be associated or equated with Fortuna. However, Nilotic scenes were in no way exclusive to sanctuaries of the Egyptian gods. [...] On the contrary. all the other Nioltic scenes which have been preserved from the Republican period come from houses and villas in or near Pompeii. The precise provenance of the other Egyptianising monuments from Palestrina is unkown. Moreover, they date from the Imperial period and they do not realy indicate that the lower complex was a sanctuary.  012},
  note = {Unteres Heiligtum - Kein religiöser Bau Considering all this Vaglieri's original interpretation, that these buildings were a group of secular buildings on the forum of Praeneste, has been defended again by Mingazzini and Kähler and most recently by Lauter. In their view the different parts of the lower complex from the left to right may be identified respectively as a Chalcidicum, a forecourt or vestibule, a basilica, and a public hall serving as a curia, tribunal hall or hall of the Adeils etc., with beneath it teh Aerarium of the town. [...] The fact that the floors of the grottoes were covered with mosaics and with water makes them hardly suitable for ritual purposes. [..] A decisive argument against the interpretation of the lower complex as a sanctuary of Isis is the colossal scale and teh central position of the complex, which must have dominated teh square lying in front of it. This implies that it must have had a public function.  013},
  note = {Unteres Heiligtum - Öffentliche Bauten mit Nymphäum For these reasons it is more logical to identify the lower complex with what it acutally seems to be, i.e. a group of public buildings situated on the forum of Praeneste. This complex consisted of an entrace-court or hall with an ornate nymphaeum, a basilica, an Aerarium and a large public hall, which could serve various purposes and which contained a second nymphaeum.  014},
  note = {Unteres und oberes Heiligtum gemeinsam geplant This spatial relationship between the different buildings strongly suggests that teh planning departed from the forum and then gradually continued uphil. The two complexes seem to be stages of a continuous process of embellishing the town of Praeneste with religious and secular public buildings. So the position and the plan of the lower complex, as well as details in construction and style, suggest that it was built shortly before the upper complex. A date c. 125-120 therefore seems the most plausible.  015},
  note = {Beginn des Interesses The interest OF THE Greeks in Egyptian religion in general, and Osiris and teh Hile flood as a religious phenomenon in particular, began in the regin of Ptolemy II Euergetes (246-221), who built the Serapeum of Alexandria and the Osiris temple of Canopus.  105},
  note = {Einfluss und Entstehungszeit des Mosaiks it would appear that the Palestrina mosaics reflect Alexandrian archetypes from the second half of the third century B.C. Naturally, given that they were themselves made around 110 B. C., they would also have been influenced by scenes in contemporary works of art. However, the lack of comparative material prevents us from deciding in how far this influence may have affected the rendering of the landscape and teh perspective.  106},
  note = {Original Aufstellungsort  In fact these scenes seem to be large-scale visualisation of natural-historical treatises which were made and collected in the Library. [...] The religious connotations of all three scenes, embracing Isis, Osiris-Sarapis and the Nile flood, and the well-being of nature due to these powers, would seem particularly appropriate for teh Serapeum and its library. [...] Scenes of this kind could also have traveled abroad, either as souvenirs of an exotic world, or in teh wake of the Egyptian cults, to decorate the sanctuaries of Isis and Sarapis in foreign parts of the Mediterranean.  107},
  key = {Meyboom510}

  note = {Definition Heiligtum mentre il tempio e l'edificio di culto vero e proprio, il santuario e una area delimitata, sacra a una divinita e caratterizzata da un insieme di edifici, anche con diverse funzioni, costruiti in relazione al culto li praticato. [...] da una parte chiamiamo cosi alcuni famosi centri religiosi di epoca arcaica, la cui grande importanza politica e commerciale lascia supporre una certa ricchezza e varieta di strutture e sembra avvicinarli ai santuari greci, come i santuari di Juppiter Latiaris sul monte Cavo e di Diana Aricina presso il lago di Nemi; dall'altra denominiamo talvolta santuari quei complessi di eta repubblicana o imperiale in cui il tempio si trova all'interno di un'area variamente monumentalizzata, come i santuari di Giunone a Gabii, della Fortuna Primigenia a Palestrain, di Giove Anxur a Terracina, di Ercole Vincitore a Tivoli; in questa accezione il termine si confonde e coincide percio con quello di temenos. La differenza di significato rispetto a tempio sta dunque solo nell'amplificata monumentalizzazione del culto.  017},

  note = {Vergoldete Fragmente, datierung schwierig da verloren Of especial interest are some fragments of tiles and revetments made of gilded bronze, which no doubt are ascribable to the temple itself. In 1885 were discoverd a number of flat roof-tiles of bronze, one of which was marked with the number XX. We are also told of a magnificent frieze of gilded bronze, with a border of beans and foliage above, and a figured representation in the lower field. These pieces now seem to be lost, but in the Museo di Villa Giula at Rome are some fragments of the same kind, found at Nemi at the same time as these. [...S. 384] In the basis of this similarity the bronze fragment might be dated to about teh same times as the terracotta plaques, i. e. to the later half of the III century B. C. [...] From the discovery of these fragments it is clear that the temple of Diana at Nemi, one of the richest and most venerated sanctuaries of Latium, was to a very large extent protected and decorated by gilded bronze plates. The use of this costly but lasting material also explains the absence of more important terracotta ornaments.  383 f},

@InCollection{Chaniotis520,
  author = {Chaniotis, Angelos},
  title = {{The Dynamics of Rituals in the Roman Empire}},
  shorttitle = {},
  keywords = {Einführung Entwicklung Gelesen Kaiserzeit Priorität Religion Vergleich},
  journal = {},
  booktitle = {Ritual Dynamics and Religious Change in the Roman Empire. Proceedings of the Eighth Workshop of the International Network Impact of Empire, 5.-7. Juli 2007, Heidelberg},
  editor = {Hekster, Olivier and Schmidt-Hofner, Sebastian and Witschel, Christian},
  address = {Leiden},
  publisher = {Brill},
  volume = {},
  number = {},
  series = {},
  LCCN = {},
  year = {2009},
  month = {},
  pages = {3-29},
  url = {http://www.gbv.de/dms/bowker/toc/9789004174818.pdf},
  school = {},
  ISBN = {978-90-04-17481-8},
  edition = {},
  LCCN = {KB Heidelberg 2007},
  note = {Religiöse Besonderheiten des Empire The Roman Empire is a model for understanding the changing functions of rituals in chaniging environments. The enormous spatial dimensions of teh Empire; its complex multicultural character; the unprecedented mobility of its population; the contrasts between teh unified administraive system and local autonomy, between old traditions and new hierachical structures and institutions, between centre and periphery, and between the local and universal; and the interplay between tradition, innovation and revival - all these are factors that affected the opertaion of rituals in religion, politics, and society.  04},
  note = {Religion unterliegt veränderungen I have chosen these episodes of Hellenistic history as an introduction to teh complex phenomenon of ritual dynamics in the Roman Empire because they encapsulate two essential features of this phenomenon - ritual transfer and the adaptation of rituals in order to demonstrate changes in relationsships - and because they date to a relatively early phase of Roman expansion.  04 f},
  note = {Einfluss des Kaisers auf die Religion After Actium, teh most important new factor in the Roman Empire was the emporer. The existence of the emperor had consequences both for social and political rituals and for the practice of religion in Rome, I mention teh efforts of the first princeps to reinforce traditional religion, including traditional rituals, and teh way in which the establishment of the principate affected the celebration of the triumph and the organistaion of spectacles by the Roman elite. The establishment of the principate introduced new ritualised forms of communication between subjects and emperor, for example the celebration of the adventus of the emperor in a city, the ritualised dispatch of embassies, the oath of loyalty, and the congratulatory rituals of cities upon the accession of a new emperor. In the cases we are dealing not with the invention of new rituals but with the adaptation of pre-existing models.  06 f},
  note = {Veränderungen der religiösen Praxis durch Rom The coming of teh Romans often brought with it striking changes in ritual agency, i.e., in the nature of the authority by wich the performance of rituals was supervised, negotiated, established, renewed, expanded, abolished, collated, changed, and explained. Until the coming of Rome, all this was an internal affair of the Greek communities. The treatment of rituals was not a simple matter; it involved complex negotiations within the community, between rituals experts and the assembly, between communities, between a community and a confederation, and between a community and its gods (especially by means of oracles).  07},
  note = {Gewährung und Veränderung des Asylrechts Here, we observe a double dynamic of ritual: on the one hand in the political interpretation of a religious institution, on the other in the replacement of  a traditional religious authority (divine oracles) with an external one. In the case of asylia, teh Romans only confirmed or abolished existing privileges. In other cases, their agency consisted in awarding privileges that affected the rituals of communities.  09},
  note = {Schnellere Verbreitung von Kult Beyond the authority of the emperor and teh representatives of Rome in the provinces, we may observe another significant change in ritual agency in the Roman Empire: the mobility of the divine word. [...] I am referring to the dissemination of divine oracles - the Sibylline oracles being the best known example.  12},
  note = {Teilweise bewusster Rückgriff auch alte Götter The text declares that a dedication was made to the gods and goddesses in accordance with the interpretation of an orcale of Apollo Klarios. [..] The exegesis may have recommended the worship of the traditional Olympian gods, although they ranked below the highest god. Thus the exegesis would have reconciled traditional religion with the rising popularity of monotheistic tendencies. [...] It is conceivable that the priest at Klaros took teh initiative of sending Apollo`s message to the Latin-speaking parts of the Empire, exactly as Alexander of Abonou Teichos made sure that the oracles of his new god became known (Lucian, Alexander 24).  15},
  note = {Imperium führt zu einer Vereinheitlichung der religiösen Praxis How the existence of an empire facilitated teh diffusion not only of ritual texts but also of uniform ritual practices can be observed in the case of dispersed communities of worshippers, such as the initiates in mystery cults - Mithraic, Dionysiac, Orphic, Egypitan. The uniform iconography and vocabulary of rituals reflect the existence of uniform rules.  16},
  note = {Religiöse Handlungen können aus ihrem Kontext genommen werden This example demonstrates the complex nature of phenomena of syncretism and cult transfer. [..] No matter how we answer this unanswerable question, it is nevertheless clear that we are confronted with a phenomenon of ritual dynamics: the performance of a ritual outside of its traditional context. [..] The transfer of rituals took place through differen channels and took a variety of forms precisely because the forms of mobility were so diverse. [..] Yet the mobility of persons and ideas under the Roman Empire enhanced this process. [..] So it is necessary to make a distinction between cult transfer and ritual transfer.  19 f},
  note = {Kaiserkult nach bestehenden Kultpraktiken modelliert The best example is the imperial cult, the rituals of wich were to a great part modelled on the rituals of the worship of the gods - with celebrations on the birthday of teh emperor, processions, the carrying of statues (cf. teh office on teh sebastophoros), sacrifices, the singing of hymns, prayers, banquets, contests, and possibly mysteries. Although there are many similarities between the Hellenistic ruler cult, as it was practiced in the poleis, and the imperial cult, we can still observe significant difference, such as the latter`s performance by provincial and other koina, new types of spectacles (gladiatorial combats and venationes), the singing of hymns by hymnodoi, the carrying of the images of emperores in processions; and the performance of prayers not only for the well-being of the emperor, but indeed addressed to the emperor.  23 f},
  note = {Besondere Kultfeste als Versuch eines Alleinstellungsmerkmals Many sanctuaries promised healing, gave oracles, or performed mysteries, but it was only the sanctuary of the snake-god Glykon New Asklepios that combined all three services. Everywhere in the Empire we encounter designations of cult officials that allude to unique local festivals and rituals. This too, is an aspect of ritual dynamics in the Roman Empire: the resistance to the trend of homogenisation throught teh revival of old local rituals (or the invention of pseudo-old rites).  28},
  note = {Keine Zentrale Romanisation The term ''Romanisation'' implies an one-sided relationship between centre (Rome) and periphery (provinces). But as recent research has made clear and as this article has argued, the religious and cultural changes in the Roman Empire are the result of far more complex processes. To understand them means to abadnon the model of the relation between centre and periphery and to re-assess the significance of local traditions, regional competitions, agency, and individual initiatives in the context of an Empire.  29},
  key = {Chaniotis520}
}

  note = {Kult nichts homogenes A site such as Cetamura shows a great diversity in the rituals performed within the limited space and within a rather narrow time-span of the 3rd and 2nd c. B.C. The modest offerings of wavers and mettal-workers there contrast markedly with the kind of votive religion evident at Cerveteri, for example, with its abundant terracotta figurines from the Manganello and Vignaccia deposits. These and teh terracottas from Protonaccio and Campetto show how cults can vary from one edge of a city to another.  139},
  note = {Verwendung von Objekten nicht immer klar Objects may be treated in ritual in many different ways. The question involving mutilation of objects are especially acute at Poggio Colla, where not only hundres of fragments of bronze were evidently considered suitable offerings, but the stone blocks and column bases of teh podium of a monumental temple seem to have been regarded as offerings from the dismantled building, after being re-arranged or turned upside down to confirm their status.  141},

  note = {Orientalische Kult nicht immer einheitlich Looking for precursors to Christianity, scholars postulated a category of ''Oriental'' or ''mystery'' cults that commingled soteriological messages with private, personal initiations. As scholars have studied them in greater detail, their similarities have faded, and their significance as a category has correspondingly diminished. What is more, these cults traveled with immigrants and so moved largely through shipping lanes; their worship was largely confined to cities and was far more common in Italy than elsewhere in the West.  102},

  note = {Fußnote 11 mit Bibliographie zum Heiligtum},
  LCCN = {Z 59},
  note = {Bedeutung der Region in der Iulisch-Claudischen Zeit There are no further reference to an Imperial villa by Lake Nemi, but finds and ancient sources wholly confirm the Julio-Claudian dynasty`s interest in the area in general, and Imperial ownership if an estate in the sacred wood apparently prevailed as late as the Constantinian era, when Constantine the Graet donated the Massa Nemus to the Basilica of John the Baptist in Albano, a church Constaine himself had built in 314.  09},
  note = {Verbindung Heligtum - Schiffe - Villa The presence of these three monuments visually and spatially connected by the lake with its emissary and its embankment and situated within this confined area generated the idea of trying to understand these structures as a possible entity inside this closed landscape room.  10},
  note = {Heiligtum kein Impuls für See in der Republik For almost 1,000 years until the 1st century BC we only have, again, a few stray finds. Life in this part of the crater was apparently not much affected by the presence of the Sanctuary fo Diana, which flourished from ca. 300 BC till the second half of the 2nd century AD. However, for two centuries, from the mid-1st century BC to the mid-2nd cenutry AD, the locality of S. Maria constituted the backdrop for luxurious villa life.  12},
  note = {Verbindung mit Heiligtum It may be suggested that the original villa architect deliberately chose to emulate the Sanctuary of Diana Nemorensis. Not only do we find the same motif of the illusionary colonnade painted on the back wall of the portico in both sites, but more importantly, the choice of the tpye of Doric capital for the villa's impressive facade portico which by the mid-1st century BC may be regarded as deliberately antiquarian, also points tothe Sanctuary as its source of inspiration. At least, the villa capital is, to my knowledge, by far the latest capital of this type used in actual architecture, even though the memory of the type featuring in majestic porticoes was still celebrated in the earlier phases of 2nd style wall painting.  35},
  note = {Umbaut 3. Phase The change in the appearance of the entire villa facade in the third phase was, as mentioned above, significant. [..] A long facade portico on a foundation featuring series of open vaulted rooms is a highly popular architecural motif commonly found among the preserved villas and also represented in the villa-scapes of the contemporary 4th style wall painting.  36},
  note = {Familie der Attier The Atti was an renowned family of Aricia. Aricia was teh main town of the Alban Hills, and it was teh local magistrates of Aricia that adminstered the Sanctuary of Diana Nemorensis. teh Atii played a certain role in the life of the Sanctuary, and stamps bearing their name have also been found there. The presence of the Ati stamps supports the proposed date of teh villa as the mid-1st century BC, and tehy may add further credence to the hypothesis that the villa was in possession of C. Iulius Caesar himself, and that his property (by his death?) may have been bequeathed to his heir, Octavian. [...] It is likely, though, that the villa or the land remained within the ownership of teh Julio-Claudian emperors. At least, it is difficult to envision teh two floating palaces of Caius Caligula without a firm base on the shore of the lake. This would, at any rate, correspond neatly with the date of the phase 2 villa, as indicated by the predominant date of the terra sigillata.  38 f},
  note = {Neronisch-Flavische Blüte The late Neronian or early Flavian period witnessed considerable activity in the villa. By that period, teh Nemi lake apparently had high prestige within the court circles. Three lead pipes (CIL CV 7840) found in 1877 in the ruins of a villa situated under the modern cemetery of Genzano and possibly one lead pipe found in 1883 show, that the forementioned villa with its marvellous double view over the lake and the sea was most likely owned by the king-maker C. Licinius Mucianus. He was a Roman consul in 67, 70 and 72 AD, and governor at Syria, and he died in 75-77 AD.  39},
  note = {Volusii This familiy (Anm. Volusii) is not completely unknown at Nemi either. One of teh main euergetes in the 1st century AD of the Sanctuary of Diana was Volusia Q. f. Cornelia as amply attested in epigraphical documents found in the sanctuary. It would therefore be an attractive hypothesis to connect the 3rd phase of the villa with the family of the Volusii Saturnini. [...] Both authors have as their main argument the date of the restoration of the small theatre in the Sanctuary of Diana nemorensis. A sizable marble plaque (2,72 m x0,66 m) with the inscription VOLUSIA Q F CORNELIA THEATRUM VETUSTATE CORRUPTUM RESTITUIT ET EXCOLUIT found in the 1920s informs us that Volusia commissioned the reconstruction and embellishment of the theater that at taht time had collapsed due to its ''old age''.  39},
  note = {Entwicklung Theater The small theatre had at least three phases, not two, as stated by Coraelli. It was built in the late Republican period and renewed in the Augustan or Tiberian period, as suggested by teh stamped bricks found in the fill of the stage.  However, it was thoroughly renovated also in the Domitianic period when teh stage thyromanta were closed and a new frons scenae with intensive use of bigio marble introduced in the Flavian period, was erected. A corridor was furthermore built behind the stage, and in the floor was found a brick with a late Domitianic stamp. The date Volusia`s reconstruction of the theatre in the (late) Domitianic period would make good sense, as it would provide something close to three quarters of a century for the theatre to collapse of ''old age''.  39},
  note = {Nymphaeum bei Theater A nymphaeum immediately south of teh theatre was also built or restored as we can glean from teh discovery also in the 1920s of eight lead pipes with the inscription Volusiae Q F Corneliae.  40},
  note = {Nemi Bedeutungsverlust im 2. Jh. Certainly by the time Domitian constructed his magnificent villa at Castel Gandolfo the Imperial focus had shifted from Lake Nemi to Lake Albano. Whether the S. Maria villa remained Imperial property also in the 2nd century AD or was in private hands is mere speculation. After the death of Domitian, he sources on teh Volusii Saturnini dry up.  40},
  note = {4 Phase und Aufgabe der Villa However, the villa`s last phase, phase 4, was also apparently one of some splendour, as it was, as mentioned above, during this phase that the villa  was thoroughly renovated with the addition of many fine opus sectile floors. [..] Apparently, the villa was abandoned in the middle or perhaps the third quarter of the 2nd century.  40},
  note = {Naturkatastrophe However, it may have fallen subject of a natural catastrophe that also necessitated repairs in the nearby Sacntuary of Diana in the same period, as ca be seen from stamps from teh brick works of L. Verus (CIL XV 737) and of Fausttina Minor (CIL XV 134, 161, 211), as well as a series of brick stamps of mid-2nd century date (CIL XV 354, 858) found in the Sanctuary, none of which have been found in the villa. As the latest brickstamp found in the villa is of the year 134 AD, it is a possibility that the villa was despoiled in order to provide material for the reconstruction of the sanctuary.  40},
  note = {Villen um den See herum Lake Nemi is the smaller of the two crater lakes gracing the Alban Hills, an extinct volcano situated no more than ca. 25 km southeast of Rome. The Alban Hills were a famed villa resort area being close to Rome, of great natural beauty and of a pleasant climate. [..] Lake Nemi is chiefly important because of Diana`s sacred groove, teh Nemus Aricinum, and her sanctuary, which was situated by the northern shore of the lake. At least four or five villas, possibly even six dotted the rim of the crater:  9},
  key = {Guldager Bilde529}

Nur wem es gelang einen Mistelzweig, der magisch auf der heiligen Eiche wucherte, in der Nähe des Tempels zu brechen, der durfte diesen König von Nemi zum Zweikampf herausflrdern. [...] A cominicare almeno dalla seconda fase si accedeva alla villa in barca dal lago, nelle occasioni ufficiali, di rappresentanza, oppure da nord, mediante la strada locale che si staccava dalla via che collegava la Appia al Santuario di Diana.  203},

@InCollection{Guldager540,
  author = {Guldager Bilde, Pia},
  title = {{The Roman Villa by Lake Nemi - From Nature to Culture  Between Private and Public}},
  shorttitle = {},
  keywords = {Gelesen Heiligtum Nemi Schiffe Villa},

  ISBN = {1824-7725},
  edition = {},
  note = {Entwicklung des Heiligtums Until c. 300 BC, the sanctuary consisted alone of a clearing, the lucus in the sacred nemus. Around this date, however, the fi rst temple in the nemus was constructed in opus quadratum, and from this point onwards can be dated the sanctuarys fl ourishing. Since there is an apparent contemporaneity between the lowering of the water, the building of a new inlet and the constructing of the temple, it is diffi cult not to consider a connection between these events. The monumentalizing of the cult and the securing of more terrain around the sanctuary after the lowering of the water is probably to be viewed in connection with the general opening up of the Alban hills to much increased traffi c and activity after the construction of the via Appia in 312 BC. [..] As there is no building activity in the villa before c. 50 BC, it is, again, likely that this last major intervention in the Nemi landscape was also connected with the major late Republican building activity in the sanctuary. The building material for the construction of the large terraced sanctuary came from the peperino quarry at the southern end of the lake; this is also true of the locality of il porto. The date 95 BC is so close to the date commonly accepted of the last quarter of thesecond century BC for the major reshaping of the sanctuary into a huge terraced construction evolving on the two large artifi cial terraces constructed in opus incertum that it cannot be a coincidence.  07},
  note = {Schiffe The lake itself was the arena for Caligulas two pleasure barges, raised from bottom of the lake in the 1920s.Their function, which was both private and public, has been discussed at length by other researchers. [..] Thus, as the major monuments of sanctuary, villa and pleasure barges were connected visually and spatially by the lake, an interpretation of the villa within this context had to be attempted.  01},
  note = {Villen um den See The Alban Hills were in general a popular villa resort area drawing on two main advantages: the natural beauty of the area and its nearness to Rome. Four to six villas dotted the rim of the crater.  01},
  note = {See Teil des Heiligtums The space inside the crater is normally thought to have been part of the sacred nemus of Diana. Why was a private villa located within this sacred space?  02},
  note = {Villa Aufbau folgt dem See und ermöglicht einen guten Blick auf das Heiligtum However, the orientation of the buildings at either end of the villa (the exedra and the bath respectively) was altered with respect to its general orientation so that the villas overall layout follows the curvature of the lake. This feature was already established during the fi rst phase of the villa. It may, of course, be a coincidence, but the curvature of the building at either end had the effect of improving the view towards the sanctuary from the owners half, while the view from the servants sector was almost cut off from the sanctuary.  03},
  note = {Von Augustus abgerissen, weil sie nicht in seine Ideologie passte This took place some time between post-50 BC and c. AD 20/30. It may be suggested that the one to do so was Augustus rather than Caesar himself. Even though the addition of the grove in its setting is very daring, the Hellenistic, almost royal,connotations provided by the Nemi villa may have been too outspoken to fit Augustus ideology.It would, at least, make better sense if the villa was torn down intentionally by the primus inter pares rather than by the dictator.  05},
  note = {Fokus des Kaiser von Nemi auf Albaner See By that period, the Nemi lake apparently had achieved high prestige within court circles. I have elsewhere suggested that the Nemi villa was lent, given or sold to a branch of the Volusii Saturnini, at some point to be inhabited by one of the main euergetes of the Sanctuary of Diana, Volusia Q. f. Cornelia, as amply attested in epigraphical documents found there.Certainly, by the time Domitian constructed his magnificent villa at Castel Gandolfo the Imperial focus had shifted from Lake Nemi to Lake Albano.  06},
  note = {Schwimmende Paläste wohl dauerhaft vor Anker The route would also pass the two fl oating palaces. It is important to stress that they must have been lying more or less permanently at the same place in the lake (probably where they were found), and were not, as is commonly assumed, moved. Onboard the ships were found a number of large-sized lead pipes. Water in considerable quantity must therefore have been brought to the ships via these veritable pipelines. The water probably came from the copious spring at le mole immediately beneath Nemi, where similar pipes have been found.  08 f},
  note = {Villa steht vermutlich seit der ersten Phase in Verbindung zu dem Heiligtum It may be suggested that the villa already in its first phase emulated the architecture of the Sanctuary of Diana. Part of the villas facade was constituted by an impressive façade portico. [..] The sanctuary capitals are nearly identical in size to the villa capitals indicating that even the heights of the porticoes were almost the same. Viewed at a distance, the two structures would, accordingly, appear rather similar with their overall ¦°-shape and extended porticoes, and the villa would, thus, provide offer a deliberate reminder of this venerated public and sacred building.  09},
  key = {Guldager Bilde540}
}

  note = {Nemi In der Englischen Ausgaben 47-55},
  LCCN = {S 699a},
  note = {Nemi Zentrum Wenn in der Folgezeit der heilige Hain der Diana in Aricia das politische Zentrum der Latiner wurde, so war dies in der Tat eine echte Neugestaltung, aber die latinischen Staaten, die sich um Aricia sammelten, waren weiterhin dieselben, mit Ausnahme von ein oder zwei, die zu diesem Zeitpunkt gerade unter der Herrschaft eines fremden Eroberers standen. Als Rom später versuchte, den Hain der Diana am Lago di Nemi durch den Hain derselben Gottheit am Aventin zu ersetzen, war das ein Versuch, Aricia in der Führung der Latiner abzulösen - nach Möglichkeit aller Latiner; der in diesem Zusammenhang erwähnte Bund ist auch diesmal kein Neugründung, sondern immer noch die Vereinigung der latinischen Staaten - und zwar grundsätzlich aller Latiner.  009},
  note = {Trotz politischem Bedeutungsverlust weiter Kult Die Kulte, um die sich jede dieser Vereinigungen konstituierten, wurden nicht aufgegeben, als der politische Hintergrund verschwand, sondern ihre Beachtung war für die Latiner weiterhin verpflichtend;  009},
  note = {Lange Pflege des Kultes Und in der Tat wurde das Zentrum dieses Bundes, Aricia, als der Vorort aller Latiner betrachtet. Als daher Rom seine Stammesgenossen veranlaßte, das Bundesheiligtum der Diana von Aricia nach Rom zu verlegen, bezweckte es damit, die Rivalin aus dieser Rolle zu verdrängen. Beide Dianakulte  bewahrten ihren Bundescharakter auch noch viel später, d.h. ihre Pflege oblag stets der Gesamtheit der latinischen Staaten.  019},
  note = {Münzen des Accoleius ... eines Denars des P. Accoleius Lariscolus, eines Abkömlings der einheimischen Aristokrate von Aricia, dargestellt ist. Seine Karriere in Rom, die 43 v. Chr. mit dem Amt des III vir monentalis oder quaestor begann, verdankte er sicher den Beziehungen seiner Familie zu Oktavian. Es konnte nachgewiesen werden, daß es sich bei den drei Göttinnen [...] um Hekate in der Mitte, die Jägerin Diana mit dem Bogen auf der rechten und - höchstwahrscheinlich - die Mondgottheit mit einer Mohnblume ind der Hand auf der linken Seite handelt. [...] Der Zypressenhain hinter der Gruppe ist zweifellos der berühmte Hain der Diana [nemus Dianae] in Aricia, deren am 13. August gefeiertes Fest in der Kaiserzeit Hecateides idus genannt wurde. Die Dreigestaltigkeit der latinischen Diana, und besonders der Dianan von Aricia, wurde auch durch Ausdrücke wie tria virginis ora Dianae [die drei Gesichter der Jungfrau Diana] charakterisiert;  045},
  note = {Dianas Bedeutungswandel Während der Tempel der Diana Nemorensis, der später den Kult unter freiem Himmel im heiligen Hain ersetzte, hauptsächlich der göttlichen Hüterin des weiblichen Lebens gewidment war, scheint die Diana triformis in der archaischen Religion der Latiner die himmliche Herrin einer kriegerischen, dreigeteilten Männergesellschaft gewesen zu sein.  045},
  note = {Politische Bedeutung Die Inschrift wurde offensichtlich zur selben Zeit wie das Kultbild dort aufgestellt, und sie spricht von der Begründung eines Bundeskultes der Diana von Aricia, mithin von einem politischen Ereignis, das in gleichem Maße Bedeutung für das Schicksal Latiums wie Etruriens und Kampaniens haben sollte.  045},
  note = {Gründungszitat bei Cato Priscian = H. R: Rel. 1², 72 fr. 58 (= Prisican 4 p 129 Hertz und 7 p. 337 Hertz) Cato Origines  Das Heiligtum der Diana im Hain bei Aricia weihte Egerius Baebius aus Tusculum als latinischer dictator. Folgende Gemeinden waren beteiligt: Tusculum, Aricia, Lanuvium, Lavinium, Cora, Tibur, Pometia, Ardea Rutulorum.  046},
  note = {Zweck des Bündnisses Auch handelte es sich nich um einen lokal begrenzten religiösen Bund, wie oft angenommen wird; das neue Bündnis war vielmehr die Antwort auf eine ernste politische Krise. [...] Der Entschluß der Latiner, ihren religiösen und politschen Mittelpunkt nach Aricia zu verlegen, muß unmittelbar nach der Eroberung Roms durch Porsenna getroffen worden sein, jedoch bevor sein Heer vor den Mauern von Aricia besiegt worden war.  048},
  note = {Latinischer Bund vs. Rom Die Aufzählungen dieser Städte bei Dionysios - er gibt 29 Städte, nimmt also das Fehlen Roms, des dreißigsten Mitgliedsstaates, an -, aber sie bezeugt die Ansicht der antiken Autoren, daß ganz Latium sich Aricia anschloß, soweit es nicht von Prosenna erobert war. Das ist der Bund, den Rom - nicht ohne etruskische Hilfe, wie ich meine - am See Regilus besiegte, nämlich Ciceros Latini omnes (Pro Balbo 23, 53) [...] In jedem Falle war die Verlegung des Bundesheiligtums auf das Territorium von Aricia eine Folge der Fortverlagerung der politischen Macht von Alba Longa und Lavinium.  049},
  note = {Nur kurze politische Bedeutung Aber einige Jahrzehnte später erscheinen die Römer als Herren von Aricia und dessen Nachbarn Ardea und ziehen aus dem Streit zwischen den beiden ihren Vorteil. Das Heiligtum der Diana Nemorensis blieb berühmt, aber seine politische Bedeutung erlosch für immer.  050},
  note = {Verlagerung des Zentrum zum Aventin Aber der Aventin war, wie sein Vorgänger, ein latinisches Bundesheiligtum der Diana [commune Latinorum Dianae templum], und der Bund konnte stets nur einen solchen Mittelpunkt für seine Bundesfeierlichkeiten haben.  084},
  note = {Auf dem Aventin ''nur'' Hain am Anfang Wir glauben nicht, daß das Heiligtum sofort einen Tempel erhielt; der lucus Dianius von Aricia mit seinem Kultbild unter freiem Himmel konnte durch die Weihungen eines anderen Haines ersetzt werden, und auch die Gründungsurkunde sprach ja von einem Altar. [...] Die Anlage eines Bundesheiligtums auf dem Aventin ist der Hauptgrund dafür, daß der Hügel außerhalb der heiligen Stadtgrenzen blieb: das Bundeszentrum mußte exterritoriale Rechte genießen.  085},
  note = {Latinische Bundesheiligtümer extraurban gelegen Bezeichnend für die latinischen Bundesheiligtümer war, daß sie sich außerhalb der sakralen Grenzen (pomerium) der jenigen Städte befanden, die ihren Kult zu betreuen hatten. Wir haben diese rechtlich bedeutsame Exterritorialität beim aventinischen Bezirk der Diana beobachtet  240},
  note = {Privater Kult statt politischem Kult Nach 340 v. Chr., als Rom die Latinerstädte von der Teilnahme am Bundeskult in Lavinium ausgeschlossen hatte und die politsche Rolle dieser heiligen Stätte auf einen Tag im Jahr beschränkt wurde, überschwemmte eine Welle privater Religiösität diesen Ort. Dies bezeugen Weihgaben an Cere und Vesperna aus einem kleinen Tempel, der von den Entdeckern des Bundesheiligtums nicht weit von diesem ausgegraben wurde;  240},
  note = {Weiblicher Kult ab dem 4. Jh und ''Fluchtgottheit'' Mit dem 4. Jahrhunder setzt die Flut der anatomischer Terrakotten ein. Nach den Exvotos zu urteilen haben alle großen Göttinnen Südetruriens und Latiums mit Geburt und Heiliung zu tun; die Häufigkeit männlicher Körperteile unter den Exvotos ist der einzige Hinweis darauf, daß diese Religion nicht völlig in der Hand von Frauen war. [...] Die allgemeine Heils- und Gnadenkraft der Gottheit wird von der Landbevölkerung auf eine Weise angefleht, die im wesentlichen aus einer Art Analogiezauber besteht. In der Flut dieser magischen Vorstellungen ist die Individualität der Götter untergegangen.  241},
  key = {Alföldi544}
}

  author = {Cain, Hans-Ulrich},

  shorttitle = {},
  keywords = {Funde Gelesen Nemi Skulptur Theater},

  note = {Sehr qualitätvoll Ab dieser Stelle können zwei der qulitätvollsten römischen Maskenreliefs eingereiht werden, die vermutlich ebenfalls im Atelier des Bildhauers von Nr. 89; 45; 79 und 86 skulpiert wurden, und zwar die Reliefs Nr. 82 und 87, [...]  143},
  note = {Stadtrömisches Atelier  159},
  note = {Interpretation nicht als Theater Ausstatung Vielfach gleichen die Masken auf den römishcen Reliefs klassizistisch-eklektischen bzw. archaistichen Idealköpfen, die weder in physiognomischer noch in antiquarischer Hinsicht eine Assoziation mit Theatermasken zulassen. [...] Fener sind hierbei insbesondere die Masken von Dionysos und Ariadne, Perseus und Andromeda, Polyphem und Galatea, Herkales, Attis und einem Triton sowie eine mönnliche bärtige Maske im Ptyus der Philosophenbildnisse zu berücksichtigen. Hätte man diese Köpfe unmißverständlich als Theatermasken gestalten wollen, entsprächen sie in ihrer Formgebung den gängigen tragischen und komischen Tpyen  [....] [S.165] Nach all diesen Einwänden gegen den Zusammenhang römischer Maskenreliefs mit dem Bereich des Theaters zeichnet sich die ikonographische Ebene ab, die auch die Bedeutung innerhalb des römischen Ausstattungsluxus klären hilft.   164 f},
  note = {Vewendung von Reliefs Die marmornene Maskenreliefs waren vornehmlich in den Peristylgärten römischer Villen und Stadthäuseraugestellt bzw. -gehängt oder in die Wände der Säulengänge eingelassen und mit vielen anderen Ausstattungsgegegenständen unterschiedlicher Themaik und Form kombiniert. [...] Es ist bezeichnend, daß diese Motive fast durchweg den Gedanken an eine sakralidyllische Umgebung evozieren. [...] Sie zählen folglich zu den Ausstattungsgütern, die aufgrund ihres typologischen und ikonographischen Zusammenhangs das sakrale Ambiente eines Villengarten ausmachten [...]  189 f},
  key = {Cain554}
}

@InCollection{Polito560,
  author = {Polito, Eugenio},
  title = {{Un gruppo di lastre marmoree con raffigurazioni di armi e Muse dal teatro di Nemi}},
  shorttitle = {},
  keywords = {Funde Gelesen Kaiserzeit Nemi Priorität Skulptur Theater},
  journal = {},
  booktitle = {Lazio e Sabina I. Atti del convegno Primo incontro di studi sul Lazio e la Sabina, Rom, 28. -30. Januar 2002},
  editor = {Brandt, J. Rasmus and Dupré i Raventós, Xavier and Ghini, Giuseppina},
  address = {Rom},
  publisher = {},
  volume = {},
  number = {},
  series = {},
  LCCN = {},
  year = {2003},
  month = {},
  pages = {251-258},
  url = {},
  school = {},
  ISBN = {8880165410},
  edition = {},
  LCCN = {Fernleihe zurück},
  note = {Grabungsgeschichte Theater I resti del teatro nemorense in contrada Valle furono rinvenuti casualmente nel 1924 e scavati estesamente da Edoardo Gatti fra il 1924 e il 1928, ma poi ricoperti. [...] La morte prematura impedì allo scavatore di dare notizi della intervento, che fu pubblicato sulla base dell documentazione del Gatti da Luisa Morpurgo, nelle Notizie degli Scavi del 1931.  251},
  note = {Theater La struttura, forse risalente alla eta tardorepubblicana o augustea, conobbe un esteso rifacimento in età giulio-claudia, promosso da una Volusia Cornelia ricordata nelle iscrizione di dedica e in fistule plumbee, la cui famiglia doveva posseder praedia nella zona.  251},
  note = {Fundort der Reliefs Per formulare ipotesi di ricollocazione non è grande aiuto il luogo di ritrovamento di almeno una parte del materiale, per il quale la Morpurgo indica la fossa al di sotto del piano della scena (F nella pianta del Gatti): si tratta evidentemente di uno scarico di materiale di varia provenienza. La omogeneità del gruppo non è pero in dubbio, stanti le caratteristiche di fattura e la sostanziale identità di dimensioni.  252},
  note = {Verwendung Volendo ammettere, come paiono suggerire i rilievi analoghi con Muse, la pertinenza dei rilievi alla edificio teatrale, si potrà supporre che siano stati realizzati per la ridecorazione di una parte non determinata del complesso, forse allo scopo di accordare la decorazione con il utilizzo dello spazio teatrale per rappresentazioni di carattere cruento. La presenza di temi bellici, trofei ed armi in teatri è attestata in qualche caso: si tratta verosimilmente sempre di alusioni evocative del carattere delle rappresentazioni.  252},
  note = {Später Umbau (?) Nel caso della ridecorazione tarda con cui abbiamo a che fare, data anche la modestia dei rilievi, si potrebbe pensare alla esigenza di delimitare la orchestra con una balaustra posticcia in occasione di giochi gladiatori o di altro tipo; i ancora si potrebbe suppore che il piccolo teatro servisse in epoca trada come luogo di addestramento di una familia gladiatoria. Accanto alla allusione al mondo della virtus cruenta attraverso le armi, i rilievi von Muse avrebbero invece ricordato lo scopo originario del teatro.  252},
  note = {Theater verbunden mit rex nemorensis Va però anche segnalato che il teatro di Nemi doveva essere collegato ai cruenti riti relativi alla succesion del rex nemmorensis, ancora vivi e periodicamente rivitalizzati in età imperiale, anchr se probabilmente in forma ''teatrale'', come e stato suggerito: forse proprio a uno di questi tentativi di recupero della tradizione locale potrebbe risalire la decorazione che c'interessa, con piena giustificazione del doppio riferimento alla funzione propriamente teatrale e alla sfera della guerra, adombrata nella lotta fra nuovo e vecchio rex.  252},
  note = {Möglichkeit das Reliefs nicht zum Theater gehören Resta comunque aperta la possibilità che i rilievi non appartenessero al teatro: potrebbero allora essere ascritti a sepolture, in cui il tema delle armi non era infrequente in età imperiale.  252 f},
  key = {Polito560}
}

@Article{Bernardi567,
  author = {Bernardi, Aurelio},
  title = {{L`interesse di Caligola per la successione del rex Nemorensis e l`arcaica regalità nel Lazio}},
  shorttitle = {},
  keywords = {Diana Entwicklung Geschichte Nemi Religion rexnemorensis},
  journal = {Athenaeum},
  booktitle = {},
  editor = {},
  address = {},
  publisher = {},
  volume = {31},
  number = {},
  series = {},
  LCCN = {},
  year = {1953},
  month = {},
  pages = {273-287},
  url = {},
  school = {},
  ISBN = {},
  edition = {},
  LCCN = {ULB Z 50/182},
  note = {Kampf im 2. Jh. n. Chr. Il costume sopravvieva in ogni caso ancora verso la metà del II sec. d. C., ma a quel tempo solo dei servi fuggitivi affrontavano il rischio del duello, unico scampo alla punizione dei padroni abbandonati.  275},
  note = {Sueton Caligulas Gegener La ferocia di Caligola sarebbe consistita nell'aver scovato un concorrente quando ancora nessuno pensava di prendere il posto del sacerdote in carica, che avrebbe cosi potuto esercitare le sue funzioni ancora per altro tempo. Anche J. Frazer, che pur  ha studiato a fondo l'episodio, prendendone lo spunto e le mosse per la sua suggestiva opera The Golden Bough, mostra di condivider il giudizio di Svetonio, quando definisce l'intervento di Caligola come un capriccio.  275},
  note = {Suetons Angaben nicht exat ..Sventonio, per il sup procedere scucito e anedotico, si rivela alieno dallo sforzo di aderire spiritualmente ai fatti narrati, che pur in se e per se possono essere del tutto esatti, viene cosi spontaneo il sospetto che l'interesse di Caligola nei confronti del rex di Nemi fosse stato determinato da una superiore necessita religiosa.  275 f},
  note = {Ritual für den moderenen Betracher teilweise schwer verständlich senza il senso di tale religiosita sempre difficile e talvolta impossibile a riesumarsi nella sua integrita, non si intendono nel loro giusto valore le manifestazioni rituali dell'antichita che possono talora sembrarci addirittura grottesche.  276},
  note = {Ermordung als Garantie der Kontituität il suo indebolimento graduale o la sua estinzione comportano anche l'indebolimento e la estinzione della comunita, donde la necessita di impedirgli di morire di vecchiaia o di malattia. Uccidendolo invece nel pieno delle sue forze, la sua anima si trasmette intatta ad un successore vigoroso che, come tale, garantisce la continuita della tribu e la sua prosperita. Il Frazer ha raccolto in gran numero testimonianze, atte a lumeggiare questo modo di sentire.  276},
  note = {Zweig des heiligen Baumes Nel bosco cresceva un albero: il rex Nemorensis vigilava costantemente affinche l'eventuale concorrente non gli si accostasse per strapparne un ramo: se fosse riuscito in tale intento. il concorrente avrebbe avuto il diritto di affrontare il rex in carica per la successione.  277},
  note = {Begründung des Heiligtums ...perche la consacrazione del bosco a Dianan, e quindi l'introduzione del suo culto in quella plaga, non sono anteriori alla fine dell VI o l'inizio del V sec. a. C., come ben risultat dal testo di un'iscrizione dedicata appunto in tale epoca da un dictator di Tuscolo a nome di un gruppo di citta latine strettesi allora in lega.  278},
  note = {rex Ritual älter => prähistorisch La presemza di un rex in quel luogo datava certo da epoca remotissima: lo fa ritenere, oltre al modo selvaggio e primitivo della successione, anceh il fatto che era vietato di avvicinare i cavalli al recinto del bosco, e questo divieto comprava che la sacerta del luogo risaliva ad epoca anteriore all'addomesticamento del cavallo.  278},
  note = {Weiter Entwicklung der Gesellschaft und ritualisierung des Rituals Accadde cosi, per un processo di innovazione mitologica, che mentre la pratica della successione del re si conservo ritualmente tal quale nella sua primitiva ferocia fino alla tarda epoca imperiale, e a tale sopravvivenza contribui certo l'essersi ridotta la carica a scopi esclusivamente sacrali, nuove interpretazioni vi is sovrapposero per renderla piu aderente ai sentimenti di societa spiritualmente cambiate.  278},
  note = {Politische Macht des rex geht verloren Cio era sentito come una magica necessita, tantochè il rito resistette a lungo in tutta la sua forza, anche quando i poteri politici del rex vennero meno e la carica si trasformo in un semplice sacerdozio.  279},
  note = {Die Zahl der ''Beweber'' um das Amt sinkt in tempi di affermantesi razionalismo non dovevano essere molti gli individui disposti ad affrontare il rischio della vita per succedere, nell'esercizio di quell truce sacerdozio, ad una persona ancora prestante. Il fatto che alla carica aspirassero solo dei servi fuggitivi e gia di per se segno eloquente dello spirito profondamente mutato dei tempi.  279},
  note = {Caligula als wieder belebung alter Kulte ...di qui l'intervento di Caligola il quale, appunto per uniformarsi a quello spirito, non volle piu che l sacerdote rimanesse in carica troppi anno, perche appunto non si affievolisse il suo vigore. Sotto un certo aspetto l'interessamento di Caligola per la successione del rex Nemorensis si puo inquadrare anche in quella piu ampia opera di ripristino e di restauro dei riti e della religione antica che fu una delle preoccupazioni di Augusto. [...] Tale intervento, anche se alla nostra sensibilita appare riprovevole, non fu cosi un semplice atto di ferocia o un inspiegabile capriccio ol a stravaganza di un folle, man una manifestazione delle convinzioni religiose e politiche del giovane principe.  279},
  key = {Bernardi567}
}

  ISBN = {951-653-277-2 },
  edition = {},
  LCCN = {ULB 96/1020},
  note = {Inschrift wichtig solange die Leitung ingebrauch That is to say, fistulae often carried stamps mentioning the owners of the conduit, information which was important as long as the fistula was in use. [..] But although water pipes could not be seen after installation, either, they often carried stamps naming their owners.  42},
  note = {Gentiv als Stifter Angabe In this paper it will be argued that occasionally the genitive can give us information of a fourth kind: it can also provide information on private benefactors to the public. In the cases discussed here we are either dealing with stamps on fistulae that had passed from private into public possession, or with stamped leadpipes that were intended as donations by the person who commissioned them in the first place.  52},
  note = {Volusia und Darius Stifter In fact both Volusia Cornelia and Darius rex clearly appear on Lake Nemi not as owners of property and water-rights but as benefactors.  54},
  note = {Hadrianische Inschrift zur Restauration The construction near Lake Nemi has usually been attributed to one of the four sons of Phraates IV, who lived in Rome under Augustus, three or more decades before Darius.  54 Anm. 66},
  note = {Volusia Theater und Wasser in einem gestiftet Since we know that Volusia Cornelia participated in the reconstruction of the theatre, it is natural to assume that her name on the fistula reveals her involvement in the construction of the water supply in connection with the theatre.  55},
  note = {Theater, Bad und Nymphaeum verbunden Water often played an important role in cultic rituals performed in theaters. There fore construction involving, e.g., the nymphaeum behind the theatre seats, and other aspects of the provision of water, were probably an integral part of the redecoration of the theatre undertaken by Volusa Cornelia.  55},
  note = {Theater muss öffentlich sein  A functional connection between the theatre and the temple are must have existed, like so often was the case in the Roman world. That makes it hard to believe that the theatre at some point (namely under Gaius) would have been incorporated by a private estate. The inscriptions found on the site argue against it. Volusia Cornelia records that she restored (retauravit) the theatre. The inscription is public, and of course would not have been erected if the building was owned privately.  56},
  note = {Inschrift auf Wassleitung reicht als Errinerung Thus, a benefactor wass assured (at least in theory) that he or she would be remembered, and that the appearance of his/her name on a lead pipe would be understood for what it was - a reminder of who had commissioned the water conduit and made it the object of an act of munificence. Nothing more than the personal name on the fistula was required to achieve this.  57},
  key = {Bruun581}
}

  note = {Nutzung der Villa und Heiligtums Kontext Life in this part of the crater was apparently not much affected by the presence of the Sanctuary of Diana flourishing between ca. 300 BC till the second half of the 2nd century AD. For two centuries, from the mid-1st century BC to the mid-2nd century AD, the locality of S. Maria was teh backdrop of luxuriant villa life. The villa had four main phases: - Phase 1, Late Republican, (mid?) 1st century BC (Caesar ?) - Phase 2, Early Imperial, ca. 20-40 AD (Caligula ??) - Phase 3, Late Neronian-Early Flavian, 60-80 AD - Phase 4, Hadrianic, 120s AD  259 f},
  note = {Ende der Villa Apparently, the villa was abandoned in the mid- or perhaps third quater of the 2nd century. the latest brickstamp found in the villa is of the year 134 AD, and ceramic finds that can be dated later than ca. 150 AD are neglegible. When the villa was abandoned, it was apparently emptied of all valuables and it was partly ribbed of its marble ornaments. The reason for the villa's abandonment is not yet completely understood. However, it may have fallen subject to a natural catastrophe that also necessitated repairs in the nearby Sanctuary of Diana in the same period. It may have been despoliated in oder to provide matieral for the reconstruction of teh sanctuary. [..] Also the sanctuary was abandoned in the second half of the 2nd century AD.  266},

  note = {Strukturen Le prime notizie sul  ritrovamento di resti di edifici, in un terreno di proprieta Marianecci, che confinava ad ovest con il perimetro del lato maggiore della area anticamente occupata dal Santuario e dal tempio di Diana Nemorense, si hanno nelle NS 1888 e 1889: in queste ultimo resoconto, in particolare, si legge che vennero alla lucce strutture murarie, datate tra I e IV sec. d.C., relative ad un impianto termale, forse dispost a piani terrazzati, pertinente ad una più vasta costruzione che occupava gran parte del piccolo promontori e che raggiungeva quasi lo spazio occupata dal santuaro di Diana Nemorense: in particolare, si notò che un ambiente, originariamente porticato, subì delle trasformazioni: tra i pilastri vennero tirate delle pareti, in modo da avere dei vanni rettangolari; il secondo ambiente rimesso in luce venne invece interpretato come calidarium e si notarono avanzi delle ipocausto; furono anche individuati resti di canalizzazioni, probabilmente da mettere in relazione con la vicinia sorgente Egeria.  281},
  note = {Viele Strukturen für kaum sichtbar Sembra che in un momento imprecisato tali strutture vennero riutilizzate per costruire una chiesa: la folta vegetazione ed i rovi che ricoprono quasi del tutto i resti murari localizzati nella orto Marianecci impediscono, però, di fare una analisi piu approfondita.  281},
  note = {Größe des Heiligtums Il tempio di Diana Nemorense occupava quasi tutta la spianata settentrionale del lago di Nemi ed era stato edificato su una vasta piattaforma artificale, sostenuata a valle da sostruzioni triangolari e a monte da nicchioni semicircolar; esisteva anche un terrazzamento superiore. Alla interno della piattaforma correvano due portici con colonne di ordine dorico. Oltre al tempio, c'erano ambienti per gli addetti al culto, celle donarie, terme ed un teatro. In totale, sembra che la area si estendesse su una superficie di oltre cinquemila metri quadrati.  281 Anm. 5},
  note = {Umwandlung der Thermen in Kirche la notevole vicinanza tra il cimitero e le strutture dove probabilmente sorse la chiesa di S.   note = {Konstantin schenkt das Heiligtum der Kirche Inoltre non bisogna dimenticare che la presenza cristiana è documentata fin da questa epoca dalla esistenza della mass Nemus, elencata nel Liber Pontificalis tra le proprieta donate dall'imperatore Costantino alla basilica di S.   note = {Ausmaß des Heiligtums Lo spazio cristiano, in questo caso, rispetto quello che era stato il centro vitale del lago di Nemi, vale a dire la area del santuario di Diana Nemoresne, che occupava quasi tutta la valle a N dello specchio lacustre con una serie di edifici, la maggior pare dei quali a carattere publico, si colloca in una posizione marginale, al di fuori del perimetro sacro pagano, inserendosi alla interno di un complesso termale, forse addirittura privato ed in relazione, probabilmente, con la finitima area sepolcrate. [...] Inoltre, si è spesso evidenziato come, proprio tra IV e VII sec. soprattutto alcuni ambienti degli edifici termali ormai caduti in disuso siano stati traformati in chiese, a volte per motivi di practicita e di ''economia''  282},

@InCollection{Bombardi588,
  author = {Bombardi, Simonetta},
  title = {{La funzione degli attori nell'ambito del santuario di Diana Nemorense}},
  shorttitle = {},
  keywords = {Funde Gelesen Geschichte Kult Nemi Theater},
  journal = {},
  booktitle = {Nemi - Status Quo. Recent Research at Nemi and the Sanctuary of Diana. Acts of a Seminar Arranged by Soprintendenza Archeologica per il Lazio, 2. - 3. Oktober, 1997},
  editor = {Brandt, J Rasmus and Touati, Anne-Marie Leander and Zahle, Jan},
  address = {Rom},
  publisher = {},
  volume = {},
  number = {},
  series = {},
  LCCN = {},
  year = {2000},
  month = {},
  pages = {121-130},
  url = {},
  school = {},
  ISBN = {},
  edition = {},
  note = {Inhalt Verknüpfung mit dem Isis Kult überaus fragwürdig, zumal die angeführten Funde umstritten und teilweise nicht aus Nemi sind Zuordnung zu Pompei schwierig muss noch geprüft werden.},
  note = {Phasen der Exedra La tecnica muraria con cui fu realizzata la struttura, ossia opera reticolata con testate in laterizio, nonché la tipologia della decorazione musiva ed i caratteri paleografici delle iscrizione mostrano che la dedica a Dina del sacello e degli ex voto che in esso dovevano essere contenuti risale ad un periodo compreso tra la fine della eta repubblicana e la prima età augustea.La ambiente fu restaurato in un momento cronologicamente successivo, probabilmente in occasione del riutilizzo per un fine diverso dall'originario, quando al suo interno furono collocate statue ed erme con relativ ritratto di svariati personaggi.  121},
  note = {Sorex Herme Fundort und Person Lo studio della Granino Cecere ha dimostrato che la tipologia della erma-ritratto, il tipo di lavorazione, le dimensioni, nonche ovviamente le notizie desumibili dalla iscrizione stessa rendono indubitabile la provenienza di questa scultura dal sacello di Marcus Servilius Quartus. Il Carius Norbanus Sorex nemorense è identificabile nell'omonimo personaggio Caius Norbanus Sorix che a Pompei fu onorato con due erme-ritratto, poste la una nel peribolo del tempio di Isisde, la altra nel calcidico della edificio di Eumachia. Anche nelle iscrizioni sulle due erme pompeiane Caius Norbanus Sorix è associato alle secundae partes, ma non è detto essere un parasitus.  122 f},
  note = {Hermen Bildnisse Il tipo della erma-ritratto di eta romana risultato utilizzato per lo piu in dediche poste in ambito familiare da congiunti, oppure da schiavi, liberti membri di associazione professionali: ostituisec quindi una delle espressioni artistiche peculiari del ceto medo, caratterizzata da senos di realismo ed avulsa da ogni  ricerca di idealizzazione.  123},
  note = {Verwendung des Theaters ; fu ipotizzato di consguenza che esso le strutture adiacenti facessero parte no del santuaro ma di un complesso di carattere privato, considerato anche il diverso orientamento. Lucia Morpurgo, rifiutando tale ipotesti, asseri invece che le estram piccolezza del teatro trovava giustificazione nella peculiare funzione sacrale dello stesso.  124},
  note = {Rex als Theater È probabile che si trattasse non del vero duello, concluso dalla morte di uno dei due contendenti, ma piuttosto della ''versione teatrale'' di questo antico rituale.  124},
  note = {Schauspieler Teil religiöser Handlungen Il contesto descritto contribuisce dunque a motivare la presenza a Nemi di attori quali i parasiti, che svolgevano usualmente la propria attivita in occasione di cerimonie religiose. È possibile tuttavia individuare un altro ben preciso ambito cultuale in cui attori, in particolare mimi, potessero esercitare la propria arte.  124},
  note = {Isis Kult in Nemi La figura di Caius Norbanus Sorex fornisce dunque una importante chiave di lettura; non è improbabile che la attore il quale a Pompei aveva legato la propria attivita alla religione isiaca, abbia impiegato il proprio talento artistico in ambito isiaco anche a Nemi.  125},
  note = {Isis Kult in Nemi Nulla e noto attualmente circa la ubicazione, la struttura e le dimensioni di questi fana; non doveva comunque trattarsi di luoghi di culto di poca importanza considerando la quantità e la ricchezza degli oggetti menzionati. [...] l'iscrizione infatti presuppone l'esistenza a Nemi di una precisa categoria di sacerdoti, gli stolistai, [...] [..] La presenza di un culto isiaco nell'ambito di un santuario dedicato alla dea Diana non deve stupire: assai frequenti sono nel mondo greco-romano le forme sincretiche di Iside con altre divinita locali. [...] Per quanto concerne in particolare il rapporto tra Iside e la Diana latina e stato osservato che entrambe le divinita presentano valenze ctonie e celesti e possiedono stretti rapporti con la luna, la acqua e la fecondita delle donne.  125},
  note = {Schiff des Caligula Isis Kult Alla iniziativa dello stesso Caligola si deve la costruzione delle due navi rinvenute nel lago nemorense; le navi dovevano con ogni probabilita esser destinate a funzione di rappresentanza ed utilizzate anche per lo svolgimento di cerimonie isiache, come attesterebbe il frammento di sistro  bronzeo proveniente da una di esse. A tale proposito deve essere ricordata il ipotesi della Morpurgo, che ha trovato seguito tra molti studiosi, secondo la quale il Navigium Isidis, ossia la celebrazione delle riapertura della navigazione che avveniva il 5 marzo, avrebbe avuto luogo a Nemi presso le rive del lago.  126},
  note = {Schule von Schauspielern Si potrebbe pensare alla fondazione di una vera e propria scuola di attori sotto il patrocinio della stessa Fundilia Rufa e sotto la direzione di Caius Fundilius Doctus. Ciò sembra essere suggerito anche dal cognomen Doctus di Fundilius, lo stesso titolo utilizzato da Orazio per Q. Roscio Gallo che aveva impiantato una scuola di teatro.  126},
  note = {Bedeutung des Heiligtums für Sklaven und Co L'elemento che ha sempre suscitato la perplessita degli studiosi e che questa dedica all'interno del santuario provenga da parte di attori, professione bollata di infamia, riservata per lo piu a schiavi, liberti e stranieri. Tale circostanza non deve comunque suscitare meraviglia, considerando la peculiarita del culto nemorense, dove la carica di sacerdote della dea era ricoperta da uno schiavo fuggitivo. [..] In epoca imperiale l'attivita teatral aveva ottenuto un grande favore da parte del popolo nonche degli stessi imperatori.  127},
  note = {Kaiserkult als Chance für lokale Bevölkerung Come ha osservato Zanker a proposito di Pompei, queste forme di culto imperiale offrivano ai notabili della citta nuove possibilita per richiamare l'attenzione su di se. Non a caso li schemi iconografici utilizzati dai personaggi municipali in tali occasioni son solenni, sono infatti le tipiche iconografie e pose con cui si usava rappresentare gli stessi membri della famiglia imperiale. [..] Il tipo statuario in veste di togato, anzi, un tempo prerogativa esclusiva di nobili ed imperatori, viene ora sempre piu utilizzato per ritrarre ed onorare privati cittadini.  128},
  key = {Bombardi588}
}

  note = {Religiöse Schauspielschule Eine irgendwie religiös gefärbte, nicht ausschließlich, aber in einem starken Maße aus Schauspielrn zusammengesetzet Vereinigung hatte sich im Heiligtum der Diana nemorensis bei Rom konstitutiert. [...] Unter den Dargestellten waren zwei sichere und ein mutmaßlicher Mime (Faustus, Sorex und Doctus I), die alle drei auch zu den parasiti Apollinis gehörten. [..] Dagegen, daß die hier bezeugten Künstler bei Aufführungen in der nahegelegenen Villa Caligulas mitgewirkt hätten, spricht, daß unter ihnen kein kaiserlicher Freigelassener war und daß Caligula kein besonders stakres Interesse für den Mimus erkennen läßt, während seine Leidenschaft für den Pantomimus (Mnester) und für die Tragödie (Apelles) deutlich ist. Eher darf man wohl an einen privaten religiösen Verband denken.  115 f},
  note = {Doctus I als Intelektueller In der ersten Hälfte des 1. Jh.s. n. Chr. gab es im nemus Dianae bei Rom einen Kreis, zu dessen Mitgliedern mehrere Mimen, aber auch ein Rhetor zählten.  Dem ebenfalls hierzug gehörenden mutmaßlichen Mimen Doctus I wurde sogar eine Statue in einem Darstellungstypus gesetzt, der auf eine intellektuelle Betätigung verwies.  128},
  note = {Schauspiel Schule Sorex war mit der Isis-Gemeinde Pompeiis verbunden: Eine seiner Hermen wurden in deren Heiligtum gefunden. Zusammen mit zwei weiteren Histrionen und einigen anderen Personen scheint er ferne zu einem Verband gehört zu haben, der im Tempelbezirk der Diana nemorensis seine schola hatte. Die Initimität des Verbandes läßt an einen orientalischen Kult denken, der speziell in diesem Heiligtum einen ägyptischen Charakter gehabt haben könnte.  132},
  note = {Sorex In Pompeii muß er [Anm. C. Norbanus Sorex] ein großes Ansehen genossen haben, denn gleichlautende Inschriften zu seinen Ehren wurden an zwei verschiedenen , für ein breites Publikum zugänglichen Plätzen gefunden: Im Gebäude der Eumachia und im Isis-Heiligtum.  297},

  note = {Reiche Händler finanzieren Umbau Numerose iscrizioni di Delo ricordano personaggi di Praeneste, sicuramente identificabili dai caratteristici gentilizi noti dalle epigrafi della necropoli mediorepubblicana della Colombella, quali gli Anicii, i Magulnii, i Saufeii, i Samiarii, gli Orcevii ecc., impegnati in attivita mercantili e bancarie che ne determinarono il rapido e notevole arricchimento: non a caso membri di queste  stesse gentes, come documentano le iscrizioni, contribuirono, sia nel ruolo di magistrati municipali che con opere di evergetismo, alla grandiosa opera di ristrutturazione urbanistica e di monumentalizzazione dela citta e del santuario di Fortuna, proprio nei decenni finali del II secolo a. C.  332},
  note = {Iseum im unteren Bereich am Forum Il bancone e l'abside sono statu riconosciuti come elementi connotativi di un edificio di culto dedicato a una divinita orientale: proprio il mosaico nilotico ne costituisce la prova piu evidente, poiche il soggetto rappresentato, certamente non casulae e non solo decorativo, sottolinea in modo palese il riferimento all'Egitto e in particolare vorrebbe simboleggiare il matrimonio mistico fra Iside, la terra egizia, e Osiride, il fiume che la inonda. L'edificio e stato quindi identificato con un iseo, forse dedicato proprio a Iside Pelagia, protettrice della navigazione, cui alluderebbe il mosaico nilotico.  332},

@Book{Altheim605,
  author = {Altheim, Franz},
  title = {{Griechische Götter im alten Rom}},
  shorttitle = {},

  ISBN = {},
  edition = {},
  note = {Lesen S. 144 f. => Rex},
  note = {Inhalt Altheim nimmt die Mythen zu erst, sieht hierin ''unmstößliche'' Belege für die Geschichte des Diana Heiligtums. Er verbindet Dinge leicht fertig miteinander und rekonstuiert dabei komplexe Zusammenhänge, ohne gesellschaftliche und soziale Aspekte zu beachten. Diana wurde mit Artemis gleich gesetzt, weil beide ähnliche bzw. gleiche Wirkungsfelder hatten, sie hatten nicht die gleichen Wirkungsfelder, weil sie gleichgesetzt wurden, noch drangen die griechischen Mythen so früh und so tief in das latinische Verständnis ein. Er setzt den Mythos als Grundlage des Heiligtums und des Rituals vorraus, dabei ist davon auszugehen, dass beide separat von einander entstanden und erst später zusammen geführt worden sind.},
  LCCN = {Z 175 (22) Keller},
  note = {Diana als alte Gottheit Es darf heute als eine allgemein gültige Ansicht bezeichnet werden, daß Diana eine ursprünglich italische Gottheit gewesen ist, deren Kult gerade in Latium von altersher an ganz bestimmte örtliche Zentren gebunden war.  093 f},
  note = {Egeria mit Egerius verbunden ..der Kult der Egeria - der Gentilgottheit ebene jener Egerii, denen der mit der Weihung des aricinischen Haines betraute Tusculaner Egerius angehörte - in Aricia in unmittelbarer Nachbarschaft der Diana lokalisiert, auch in Rom in ihrer nächsten Nähe, am Fuße des Aventin, wiederkehrt; es ist schließlich der Charakter der Diana als Frauengottheit, der in beiden Kulten als Mittelpunt stehend hervortritt. [...] Vor Allem Vulven und Phallen in größerer Anzahl, daneben auch Statuetten von Müttern mit Wickelkindern auf den Armen. Das weist bereits mit Sicherheit auf eine Frauengottheit hin.  094},
  note = {Diana als Mondgöttin Schon an sich nämlich darf man es erwarten, einer Göttin des weiblichen Geschlechtslebens, bei den bekannten Beziehungen beider Sphären zueinander, zugleich als Göttin des Mondes zu begegnen. Überdies aber besitzen wir von nächtlichen Fackelzügen der Frauen im Kulte der Diana noch unmittelbare literarische Kunde.. [S. 97] Die spätere Zeit vollends hat Diana mit Luna schlechthin gleichgesetzt, so, wie es auch mit Artems und Hekate geschah.  096 f},
  note = {Mondgöttin ethymologisch Auch Diana also würde die ''Glänzende, Leuchtende'' und damit die Göttin des Mondes selbst bedeuten.  098},
  note = {Jagtgöttin später In der Kaiserzeit bzw. in dem 1. vorchristlichen jahrhunder,dem gleichfalls ein Teil der Stücke entstammt, war demnach in Aricia die Auffassung als Jadgöttin eine durchaus übliche. Daß sie es aber nicht erst damals geworden ist, zeigt ein weitere Fund, der der unmittelbaren Umgebung entstammt.  103},
  note = {Diana Herrin der Tiere Die Betrachtung unserer Denkmäler hat uns gezeigt, daß nicht nur in Campanien, sondern ebenso auch in Latium zu Beginn des 5. Jahrhunderts Diana überall als Herrin der Tiere dargestellt, also mit Artemis als identische empfunden wird. Will man also, wie man das bisher getan hat, daran festhalten, daß Diana eine ursprünglich selbständige italische Gottheit gewesen und ihr Zusammenhang mit Artemis erst ein sekundäres Moment sei, so wird man wenigstens so viel zugegeben müssen, daß dieser Zusammenhang bis in jene sehr alte Zeit hinaufreicht, daß also schon damals die Einwirkung des griechischen Artemisbildes auf das der italischen Diana begonnen habe.  105},
  note = {Lage des Heiligtums Das Heiligtum erhob sich unmittelbar am Ufer des Sees auf einer flachen, den allseitig steil aufsteigenden Uferrändern vorgelagerten Niederung, die heute den Namen ''Giardino'' trägt. Die Lage ''umentia circum litora'' (Verg. Aen. 7, 763) erinnert sofart an das spartanische Orthiaheiligtum [Anm. griech] ev Aiµvais, and die [Anm. griech] Aiµvatis und was wir sonst von der Analge anderer Heiligtümer auf sumpfigen Blachfeldern, an Flußniederungen und Ähnlichem hören.  122},
  note = {Virbius ..eine ältere, der Folgezeit unverständliche gewordene Gottheit - wie man glaubte: ein einheimischer, bei der Entbindung hilfreicher Dämon oder auch ein ursprünglich pferdegestaltiger Gott - sei, ausgehend von der Tatsache, daß der aricinische Hain von Pferden nicht betreten werden durfte, von der ''hellenisierenden Gelehrsamkeit der späten Republik'' mit dem Genossen der Artmis in Verbindung gebracht worden wie diese selbst mit Diana.  122 f},
  note = {''Peleponnesischer'' Einfluss In der tat stoßen wi dann darauf, daß, ebenso wie die Gründungslegende von Aricia nach der Peloponnes verwies, so auch die der Virbiussage genau entsprechende Form der Hippolytossage, die Erweckung durch Asklepios, wiederum gerade in der Peloponns begegnet.  123},
  note = {Egeria Die Vermutung liegt zum Mindesten nahe, daß die enge Verbindung der römischen Egeria mit der Vesta ihrerseits auch wieder auf den aricinischen Dianenkult eingewirkt habe. Und dies dürfte denn doch entschieden für die römische Herkunft der Egeria sprechen.  129},
  note = {Diana griechischer Herkunft Die griecische Herkunft der Diana und ihres Kultes hat dami von allen Seiten her ihre Bestätigung empfangen.  142},
  note = {Rex und Gladiatorenkampf Und wenn wir dann hören, daß man das erste römische Gemälde eines Gladiatorenkampfes  eben in dem Haine der Diana aufgestellt habe, so war offenbar die Übereinstimmung mit dme Zweikampf des Rex Nemorensis der entscheidende Grund: Hier wie dort waren es Unfreie und Verfehmte, die um das Leben und Rettung kämpfen  145},
  note = {Rex Herkunft Denn daß im Rex Nemorensis, wie man gemeint hat, eine Parallelerscheinung zum römischen Rex sacrorum oder ein Rest latinischen Königtumes vorliegt, wäre wiederum nur dann denkbar, wenn der Nachweis gelänge, daß der Besitz der Ämter nicht von Anfang an den Sklaven vorbehalten war.  145},
  note = {Flüchtige können Rex werden Sondern, wenn Strabon lediglich von [Anm. griech]..[...] Status von ''profugi reges'' oder Ovidius von ''pedibus fugaces'' spricht, so darf doch die Möglichkeit nicht ganz abgewiesen werden, daß damit Flüchtige schlechthin gemeint sind, landflüchtige oder vogelfreie Verbrecher, die an sich wohl Sklaven sein konnten, es aber nicht notwendig sein mußten.  146},
  note = {Fremde als Priester Es ist der ''Fremde'', der in beiden Fällen als der Priester der Göttin erscheint. Und dabei fällt uns sogleich ein anderes Zeugnis ein, das geeignet sein dürfte, diese Auffassung zu bestätigen: Auch Iphigenie ist als Priesterin der taurischen Artemis eine Fremde gewesen.  147},
  note = {Diana keine eigene Gottheit Wiet entfernt davon, eine ursprünglich selbstständige italische Gottheit zu sein, hätte sich uns Diana demnach nicht nur als identisch mit der Artmies erwiesen, sondern uns in einem Falle überhaupt erst dazu verholfen, einen altertümlichen und bezeichnendne Zug an ihrem griechischen Vorbild richtig zu erkenn und in seiner Beziehung zu dessen göttlicher Gestalt zu erfassen.  150},
  note = {Schwert gegen Schwert Denn daß der Zweig eines bestimmten Baumes als Waffe habe dienen müssen, wird nicht gesagt: Es handelt sich lediglich darum, daß der Neuankömmling, der mit dem Anspruch auf das Königsamt auftritt, einen Zweig dieses Baumes pflückt, bevor er zum Kampfe schreitet.  151},
  note = {Alter Ritus Überall demnach handelt es sich um den gleichen Brauch eines tatsächlichen oder ehemaligen Fremdenopfers, und ihm gerade auch bei der Artemis zu begengen, darf nicht Wunder nehmen. [...] Also etwas, was mit einer solchen Erneuerung oder Wiederherstellung zwar nicht identisch ist, aber ih dem Ergebnis nach gleichkommt. Und dieses Verlangen wird dann durch die Einführung des Zweikampfes um die Würde des Rex Nemorensis erfüllt.  153},
  note = {Nemi als direkter Ableger von Tauros Und von da aus verstehen wir auch, warum der aricinische Zweikampf als ''reparatio'' der taurischen Fremdenopfer bezeichnet werden konnte. Nachdem das Bild der Göttin in Aricia einen neuen Sitz gefunden hat, muß das ihm Zukommende auch dort entrichtet werden. [S.155.] .. - stests von Neuem die Tat des Orests wiederholen, um dieses Schutzes teilhaftig zu werden: Er muß im Zweikampf den vorigen König erschafen, wie Orests eines den Thoas erschlagen hat, um so die Göttin für sich zu gewinnen und als hr Diener dann selbst ''König'' zu sein.  154},
  note = {Rex Wir können zwar die Frage aufwerfen, auf welche Weise beide Institutionen zustande gekommen seien, ob z. B. die taurische Sage von vornherein maßgebend bei der Schöpfung dieser Institutionen eingewirkt oder ob sich die Sage erst nachträglich an einen bereits bestehenden Brauch angeknüpft haben, und was dergleichen mehr ist. [...] Immerhin wird soviel deutlich geworden sein, daß auch dieser seltsame und, wie es zunächst scheint, ganz einzigartige Brauch aus seiner Zugehörigkeit zum Kulte der Artemis und aus ihrem besonderen Wesen heraus sich deuten läßt.  156},
  key = {Altheim605}
}
